summary: This is an Answer filed by the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) in response to a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times Company. The BOP denies or avoids admitting most allegations regarding its handling of FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein's death, while admitting that Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.

persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the attorney representing the defendant, the Federal Bureau of Prisons, in this FOIA lawsuit. He signs the Answer.

persons.name: Steven J. Kochevar

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document confirms his death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, and references the criminal case against him (United States v. Jeffrey Epstein).

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, is representing the BOP as its attorney in this FOIA lawsuit.
Kochevar is an Assistant U.S. Attorney working under/for U.S. Attorney Berman, and filed this Answer on his behalf.
The BOP was the agency responsible for incarcerating Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at the time of his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The BOP admits this fact in its Answer.

events.title: NY Times FOIA Request
events.description: The New York Times Company submitted FOIA requests to the BOP (referenced as August 12/13, 2019 requests). The subject of these requests is central to the lawsuit.

events.title: Filing of BOP's Answer
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons files its formal Answer to the New York Times Company's FOIA lawsuit in the Southern District of New York.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) formally admits that Jeffrey Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
The document is a legal Answer filed by the BOP in response to a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times Company seeking records related to Epstein's death.
The BOP denies or claims insufficient knowledge to respond to most allegations about its handling of the FOIA requests, asserting multiple legal defenses.
The case referenced is United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, No. 19-CRIM-00490 (S.D.N.Y.).
The BOP's position is that the plaintiff is not entitled to the requested relief or any relief whatsoever.
